questions.text: Tuberculosis with polyarthritis is called as:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Poncet’s disease

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option C. von Gierke’s disease . Glycogen storage disease type I (GSD I), also known as Von Gierke disease, is an inherited disorder caused by deficiencies of specific enzymes in the glycogen metabolism pathway. It comprises of 2 subtypes, GSD Ia and GSD Ib. In GSD Ia, there is a deficiency of enzyme glucose-6-phosphatase, leading to hypoglycemia and lactic acidosis. Patients with GSD 1b have normal G6Pase enzyme activity but have a deficiency of the transporter enzyme, glucose-6-phosphate translocase (G6PT), manifesting as hypoglycemia and metabolic acidosis typically around 3 to 4 months of age. In suspected patients, genetic testing is the investigation of choice to confirm the diagnosis. Dietary treatment prevents hypoglycemia and improves the life expectancy of patients.
  • • Option C. von Gierke’s disease
  • • Option D. Gordon’s disease . Gordon Syndrome is a rare, inherited disorder that affects movement in the joints of the upper and lower limbs, also known as distal arthrogryposis. Patients can be born with several fingers fixed in a flexed position (camptodactyly), clubfoot, and an opening in the roof of the mouth (cleft palate). Their joints are often very stiff or unable to move. Intelligence is usually normal. Gordon syndrome is caused by genetic mutations in the PIEZO2 gene and can be inherited in an autosomal dominant pattern. Gordon syndrome is diagnosed by clinical examination and genetic testing. Treatment is directed at the symptoms and includes surgery and physical therapy to loosen the joints.
  • • Option D. Gordon’s disease
  • • Gordon Syndrome
  • • Educational objective:
  • • Educational objective:
  • • Tuberculosis with polyarthritis is called Poncet’s disease, a reactive arthritis that occurs during the active stage of TB.

questions.text: In tuberculosis of spine, which one of the following is not a cause for Paraplegia?

options.label: A
options.text: Stretching of spinal cord in gibbus deformity

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Spinal artery compression

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Paraplegia in spinal tuberculosis can be caused due to stretching of the spinal cord from the gibbus deformity/from compression by the granulation tissue/from edema of the spinal cord. Spinal artery compression is the rarest cause of paraplegia due to tuberculosis of the spine. But when it is the cause, it has the poor prognosis. Spinal artery compression can cause dizziness, vertigo, ataxia, dysarthria, and dysphagia to progressive or acute paralysis, hemisensory loss, and cervical myelopathy.

questions.text: Triple deformity of knee is classically seen in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Tuberculosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most common cause of triple deformity of the knee is tuberculosis of the knee joint. Triple deformity is more common in TB of the knee than in other types of arthritis because it is a chronic infection and the bacteria slowly destroy the joint tissues, leading to the development of deformities. Another reason is that TB often affects the posterior capsule of the knee joint, which stabilize the joint. When this ligament is damaged, it can allow the knee to become unstable and deformed.
